clinical_study.brief_title: Prognosis of Inpatients Evaluated for Palliative Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of Prognosis of Inpatients Evaluated for Palliative Radiotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: Understanding patient's prognosis is of utmost importance to determine radiotherapy's indication and dose/ fractionation. The investigators plan to conduct an observational study of prognosis of inpatients evaluated for palliative radiotherapy at a large cancer hospital in Brazil.

primary_outcome.description: Overall Survival in the studied population

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival in Each Indication of Palliative Radiotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival in Each Indication of Palliative Radiotherapy. The indication will be as follow: spinal cord compression brain metastases tumor bleeding tumoral mass Oncologic Pain Superior Vena Cava Syndrome/ Airway compression

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival by Palliative Prognostic Index (PPI)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be divided into 3 subgroups according to the PPI. Survival differences between the different subgroups will be compared and analyzed

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival by Survival Prognostic Score (SPS)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be divided into 3 subgroups according to the SPS. Survival differences between the different subgroups will be compared and analyzed

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival by Score Index for Stereotactic Radiosurgery for Brain Metastases (SIR)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will brain metastases will be divided into 3 subgroups according to SIR. They will be divided into SIR 0-3; 4-7;8-10. Survival differences between the different subgroups will be compared and analyzed
Positive Predictive Value of PPI to predict death at 3 weeks and 6 weeks.

arm_group.description: Inpatients evaluated for palliative radiation therapy.

study_pop.textblock: Inpatients evaluated for palliative Radiation Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All inpatients evaluated for palliative radiation therapy at ICESP (Instituto do Cancer do Estado de Sao Paulo)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inpatients evaluated whose intent of treatment is curative
- Patients who are unwilling to participate in the study or unwilling to sign informed consent

facility.name: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de Sao Paulo, Hospital das Clinicas da Faculdade de Medicina da USP
